page.title: 12 LIFE IN RINGMORE 2
page.content: The lanes in the area are narrow, poorly maintained or not surfaced at all. The hedgerows are uncut and con- tain a profusion of plants. There is much honeysuckle, bramble, foxglove and campion among the flowering plants. There was evidence of a healthy rabbit population with runs and burrows hedgerows. A variety of insects were in evidence - snails, spiders, slugs, ants and grasshoppers were easily spotted. We also saw many birds - robins, black- birds, skylarks and thurshes. Apart from access to the fields the lanes in the area were much used by local people for recreation. On our trip we encountered people on horseback 3 times and were told that they often used these lanes for riding. The residents of the area walk their dogs or simply enjoy a peaceful walk around the lanes.
